intro: Rosa × salaevensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the Siberian rose or Russian tea rose, is a hybrid rose species originating from Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces fragrant, semi-double flowers in shades of pink and white. The plant has a deciduous nature, shedding its leaves in the autumn season. Its foliage is typically covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and adaptability to various garden conditions.
